intro: Dorstenia multiformis, commonly known as the variable dorstenia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Dorstenia multiformis is often grown as a decorative plant due to its unique foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
